doc: Patrick Stewart https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Stewart 1 Sir Patrick Stewart (born 13 July 1940) is an English actor whose work has included roles on stage, television, and film in a career spanning almost six decades. He has been nominated for Olivier, Golden Globe, Emmy, Screen Actors Guild and Saturn Awards on multiple occasions. Beginning his career with a long run with the Royal Shakespeare Company, Stewart received the 1979 Laurence Olivier Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role for his performance in Antony and Cleopatra on the West End. Stewart's first major screen roles were in BBC-broadcast television productions during the mid-late 1970s, including Hedda, and the I, Claudius miniseries. From the 1980s onward, Stewart began working in American television and film, with prominent leading roles such as Captain Jean-Luc Picard in Star Trek: The Next Generation and its successor films, as Professor Charles Xavier in the X-Men series of superhero films, the lead of the Starz TV series Blunt Talk, and voice roles such as CIA Deputy Director Avery Bullock in American Dad! and the narrator in Ted. Having remained with the Royal Shakespeare Company, in 2008 Stewart played King Claudius in Hamlet on the West End and won a second Olivier Award. In 1993, TV Guide named Stewart the Best Dramatic Television Actor of the 1980s. He received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on 16 December 1996. In 2010, Stewart was knighted by Queen Elizabeth II for services to drama. Sir_Patrick_Stewart ( born 13_July_1940 ) is an_English_actor whose_work has_included roles on stage_,_television , and film in a_career spanning almost_six_decades . Having_remained with the_Royal_Shakespeare_Company , in 2008_Stewart played King_Claudius in Hamlet on the_West_End and won a_second_Olivier_Award . {PERSON[Patrick_Stewart]} ( born 13 July 1940 ) is an English actor whose work has included roles on stage , television , and film in a career spanning almost six decades . He has been nominated for {PERSON[Olivier]} , {ORGANIZATION[Golden_Globe]} , Emmy , Screen Actors Guild and Saturn Awards on multiple occasions . Beginning his career with a long run with the {ORGANIZATION[Royal_Shakespeare_Company]} , {PERSON[Stewart]} received the 1979 {PERSON[Laurence_Olivier]} Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role for his performance in {PERSON[Antony]} and {PERSON[Cleopatra]} on the West End . {PERSON[Stewart]} 's first major screen roles were in BBC-broadcast television productions during the mid-late 1970s , including {PERSON[Hedda]} , and the I , {PERSON[Claudius]} miniseries . From the 1980s onward , {PERSON[Stewart]} began working in American television and film , with prominent leading roles such as Captain {PERSON[Jean-Luc_Picard]} in Star Trek : The Next Generation and its successor films , as Professor {PERSON[Charles_Xavier]} in the X-Men series of superhero films , the lead of the {ORGANIZATION[Starz]} TV series Blunt Talk , and voice roles such as {ORGANIZATION[CIA]} Deputy Director {PERSON[Avery_Bullock]} in American Dad ! and the narrator in {PERSON[Ted]} . Having remained with the {ORGANIZATION[Royal_Shakespeare_Company]} , in 2008 {PERSON[Stewart]} played King {PERSON[Claudius]} in {LOCATION[Hamlet]} on the {LOCATION[West_End]} and won a second Olivier Award . In 1993 , TV Guide named Stewart the Best Dramatic Television Actor of the 1980s . He received a star on the {ORGANIZATION[Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame]} on 16 December 1996 . In 2010 , {PERSON[Stewart]} was knighted by Queen {PERSON[Elizabeth_II]} for services to drama .
